title: Additional IP
titleBis: Bring more flexibility to your applications with Additional IPs.
description: Many OVHcloud products come with preconfigured static IPv4/IPv6 addresses. These products are also compatible with public Additional IPs, providing increased flexibility and availability.
descriptionBis: You can assign an Additional IP (individual address or IP block) to any compatible service within the same campus. A campus is a group of datacentres that share the same geographical location. For more information, please visit our dedicated page.
guide1Description: Find out how to add Additional IP addresses to your instance configuration
guide2Title: Configuring an IP address as an alias
guide2Description: Find out how to add Additional IPs to your configuration
guide3Title: Configure the network on Proxmox VE
guide3Description: Find out how to configure the network on Proxmox VE
guide4Title: Concepts - Additional IP or Floating IP on Public Cloud
guide4Description: Find out how to use public IP addresses as part of the Public Cloud network
guide5Title: Configuring an Additional IPv6 block in a vRack
guide5Description: Find out how to configure an Additional IPv6 block within an OVHcloud vRack
advantage1Description: Easily assign and move IP addresses between OVHcloud services: VPS, Bare Metal, Public Cloud, vRack network, IPLB, etc.
advantage2Description: Your customers can contact your services using IPv4 and IPv6 address types. This option provides end-to-end native connectivity for performance and next-generation IP support (available via the vRack network).
advantage3Description: Expand your project for a global audience by leveraging additional geolocated IPs. By enabling IPs to be geolocated in a specific country, you can improve the ranking of your projects in popular search engines (i.e., SEO performance).
advantage4Description: Use additional IPs for load balancing, clustering, or high-availability configurations with VRRP in dual configurations (IPv4 and IPv6), available only via the vRack network.
advantage5Title: Migrating to the cloud with BYOIP
advantage5Description: Import your IP blocks and use them within OVHcloud as additional IPs. (BYOIPv6 coming soon). Find out more about BYOIP
optionsAddressTypesIpv4: Unique IP address (/32) IP block (between /30 and /24)
optionsCostIpv4: From { } prices from Agora { } â‚¬ per IP
optionsCompatibleServicesIpv4: Bare Metal Cloud Public Cloud Hosted Private Cloud IP Load Balancer Any service compatible with the vRack
optionsFootnote: The availability of a particular type or mode of IP may vary depending on the service that this Additional IP will be linked to.
geolocationNote: IP geolocation is the mapping of an IP address to its corresponding physical location (country), irrespective of where the service is actually hosted (region).
